header.title: Man filmed ‘blacked up’ as beach seller in Ibiza
header.postText: There are some ridiculous people out there who still think it’s OK to ‘black up’.', 'Like this man, who was filmed wandering around Ibiza covered in black paint in a bid to resemble an African sunglasses vendor.', 'In the shocking clip, the man – who was on the island with a number of friends – can be seen wearing a monkey toy around his neck and an umbrella hat.', 'The footage was branded ‘racist’ and ‘ridiculous’ by hundreds of people on Facebook before the uploader pulled it from the internet.', 'In the video, crowds can be heard chanting ‘looky looky’ as some other men call over an actual vendor and tell them to stand together.', 'Despite friends of the man finding the clip funny, commenters online did not.', 'Simone Adele Brathwaite commented: ‘So racist. He could’ve done this without having to do black face.’', 'Paul McEvoy said: ‘What is going on here? Can nobody see this clear is racism and insensitive yet everyone is tagging their friends thinking it’s funny?’', 'Fayo Ibidapo added: ‘This is disgusting! I hope all the people liking this and commenting monkey emojis know that this is blatant racism and blackface. You need to check yourselves. This is unacceptable.’', 'The video comes just days after Alan Sugar sparked outrage after he posted a racist tweet about the Senegal World Cup football team.', 'Writing on Twitter, the host of BBC show The Apprentice wrote: ‘I recognise some of these guys from the beach in Marbella. Multi tasking resourceful chaps.’', 'Alongside his caption, he shared a picture of sunglasses and handbags on sale on what appears to be a beachfront to his 5.47million followers.', 'His tweet led to hundreds of people branding the 71-year-old entrepreneur ‘racist’. Yet despite this, Lord Sugar, who is the 95th richest person in the UK, defended his tweet and asked people what was wrong with it. In response to one person who called the post ‘terrible’, he replied: ‘Why?’
